Trade/Device Name(s): Verigene Clostridium difficile Nucleic Acid Test (CDF)
Regulation Name(s): C. Difficile Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Assay
Analyte(s): single base pair deletion at nucleotide 117 in tcdC
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for Verigene Clostridium difficile Nucleic Acid Test (CDF), a multiplexed PCR and nanoparticle-based hybridization assay for rapid detection of toxigenic C. difficile DNA in stool on the Verigene System.
Indications for Use Summary: Qualitative multiplexed in vitro diagnostic test on the Verigene System for rapid detection of toxin A (tcdA), toxin B (tcdB), and tcdC gene sequences of toxigenic Clostridium difficile and presumptive identification of PCR ribotype 027 strains from unformed stool, as an aid in diagnosing C. difficile infection; detection of ribotype 027 is for epidemiological purposes only.
